name: Hotel Villa Mazarin

reviews.title: Charming, comfortable, convenient!
reviews.text: We spent a delightful week at the Villa Mazarin in early October - my husband's first Parisian visit, and my first with a credit card! Location is perfect - including an easy walk to the RER and subway (we took the RER from the airport and walked to the hotel from Chatelet Les Halles). We loved the neighbourhood.

reviews.title: A dreadful experience
reviews.text: We had requested a superior, quiet room and were given a spacious room overlooking the courtyard. We slept with open windows all week, and heard no noise other than high heels walking (echoing!) across the courtyard when someone came in, in the wee hours. We also happened to be there the night France won at rugby in the championships, when there was lots of revelling in the streets. My husband got up about 3 am to use the washroom and could faintly hear the noise in the streets while at the window by the bathroom - otherwise, we heard nothing.

reviews.title: lovely hotel
reviews.text: The room was quite pleasant. The king bed was perfectly comfortable. While generally the light in the room was low there were strong reading lights at the bed, and good lighting in the charming bath. The shower was surprisingly pleasant with decent water pressure and plenty of hot water. If pressed, our only complaint was a very few hangers in the very large closet.

reviews.title: Marvellous Mazarin
reviews.text: Yes, there is no lounge - but when you can sit in cafes in the neighbourhood soaking up the atmosphere, not sure why you'd need one. Yes, the entry is small, and there was some painting underway, but hardly an issue.

reviews.title: The place to stay in Paris = Hotel Villa Mazarin
reviews.text: We would not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

reviews.title: Nice little hotel in the heart of the Marais district
reviews.text: My daughter and I stayed at Villa Mazarin for 7 days in early August. We had a Superior room on the second floor looking out on two streets. There was considerable street noise at night but not more than you would expect in the heart of the Marais district. With the windows closed it was fine. Very little noise from adjoining rooms. Our room was a good size and the hotel is non smoking.Our room as well as the halls and reception area was spotless, our beds were comfortable and the little kitchen area was perfect for early morning coffee and a place to store our wine.

reviews.title: Good-sized clean rooms but service could be improved
reviews.text: We found the staff friendly and helpful, some more than others but this could have been a language problem.

reviews.title: Villa Mazarin (Big Ruby's Paris)
reviews.text: The hotel is well situated for the Metro or walking to major attractions and close Notre Dame and the Louvre.

reviews.title: Very happy with the VIlla Mazarin
reviews.text: Our experience was totally a positive one.

reviews.title: Loved the location but!
reviews.text: We booked a standard room at the Villa Mazarin. We found it centrally located (we walked to most of the major tourist sites) and the rooms were decent sized and comfortable. What let it down somewhat for us was the service at the front desk - they were by no means rude, but made you feel like you were bothering them if you asked them any questions. If the service were more personable and efficient, then we would have had no complaints about the Mazarin.

OK that might be overdoing it a little, but we loved this hotel. A group of 12 of us booked it as it was in the Marais, with good reviews, fair prices and with a suite for socialising. The hotel reception is small and non-descript, but the rooms are stylish and clean. The duplex suite (number 56) is about the same size as many Parisienne apartments, and the standard rooms were all much more generous than other hotels in Paris I have stayed in.I loved the fact that you got proper hairdryers and irons with ironing boards in the room, and not those stupid things that are attached to the wall. The staff on reception were generally helpful and friendly, and put up with us very graciously, as there was much faffing around when we all arrived. There isn't much in the way of public areas in the hotel - bar, breakfast room etc (you can order breakfast to your room), but when you are in the Marais you don't need this. The location is excellent for bars and cafes, restaurants and most things you would want in Paris. Thank you to the team at Villa Mazarin for helping to make our weekend such a success.
reviews.title: C'est magnifique!

likes.liked: — The rooms, the location, the friendly staff
likes.disliked: — There was some confusion about where to leave bags when we checked out, and the housekeeping seemed to take ages to get round to cleaning the rooms.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Having tried many and various hotels for a weekend visit, we were offered a spacious room at the Villa Mazarin, slightly more than we really wished to pay, but didnt think we could do better in the time available. I spoke directly with the manager and found him extremely helpful.
reviews.title: A delightful hotel

likes.liked: — Quality of furnishings, staff interest in guests, tea and coffee makers in room.

reviews.text: We were delighted with the accommodation, especially the fact that the room had tea and coffee making equipment, plus a fridge. Bedlinen was beautiful and the enormous towels were a delight. Everything was of very good quality. Staff were very helpful, calling taxis, recommending restaurants etc. We really couldnt fault it.
reviews.title: great location

reviews.text: Breakfast is best taken at the cafe below the hotel, friendly and good service, orange, coffee/tea, croissants, all for 6.95 euros. There is a huge choice of places to eat. We liked the nearby Coude Fou in the Bourg Tibourg, a buzzy little wine bar with good food.
reviews.title: Great stay in the Marais
Great little hotel in the heart of the Marais
reviews.text: We would certainly go back to this relaxing and caring hotel.

reviews.title: Beautiful Boutique Style Hotel
reviews.text: My boyfriend booked this hotel as a surprise for my birthday, and what a surprise it was. Once you enter the small entrance this hotel is bursting with charm and elegance. Staff were very pleasent and even spoke in english when we made our best attempt at french! Room was beautiful, with a boutique style. Bathrooms were lovely too. Very clean and bed was out of ths world with comfort. Location was brilliant, central to everything, nightlife and tourist attractions. Can't wait to vist again. Made my first trip to Gay Paris a most memorable and enjoyable experience.

reviews.title: One of the best kept Secrets in Paris
reviews.text: I booked this hotel through an Orbitz.com promotion with Breakfast: 5 nights at $800 EU. This has to be one of the best kept secrets in Paris: Two blocks from the Siene River, 3 blocks from St Louis Island. The hotel is across from Paris City Hall: "Hotel de Ville" which is also a very convenient Metro Stop. If you dare walk, it's a mere 10 blocks from the Louvre.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: I have to admit that I was very apprehensive about booking this hotel and the pictures looked as it it may be dirty and old, but it was a very pleasant surprise to see that it was a very well kept, charming and clean hotel at a convenient price. The hotel lacks a restaurant, however, each room has a table and chairs because breakfast is brought to your room every morning if you so desire. You place yoru bkfast order the day before and it arrives at the time you indicate. The staff at the hotel was very helpful, though the reception area is very small. I was surprised to see a large elevator at this hotel which is not the two person elevator standard in most of Europe. I strongly recommend this hotel as a centrally located and charming tourist hotel.

reviews.title: Three and a half to four stars
reviews.text: Good clean hotel in a great location and within easy walking distance of good restaurants and bars and many of the cultural delights of Paris.

reviews.title: Mazarin - Very Highly Recommended
reviews.text: The hotel has a small entrance, but once you have found the street it really is not hard to find.

description: En plein coeur de Paris, dans le quartier du MARAIS, la Villa Mazarin vous accueille.En quelques pas, vous atteignez Notre-Dame, le Centre Georges Pompidou, l’'Ile Saint-Louis, l’'Hôtel de Ville, la Place des Vosges, le Musée Picasso et les ruelles historiques du Marais, haut lieu de la mode, de la gastronomie et de la vie nocturne.Pour rallier le Louvre, le Musée d’'Orsay, le Quartier Latin, il vous suffira d’une courte promenade le long des berges mythiques de la Seine.
